medical_history.chief_complaint: Incapacitating daily headaches and ongoing loss of visual acuity.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began with chronic headaches and visual impairment, progressively worsening over 11 months. She underwent a lumbar puncture that revealed high intracranial pressure (ICP) of 38 mm Hg, followed by another lumbar puncture showing ICP of 29 mm Hg four months later. Symptoms remained unrelieved despite treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Obesity, arterial hypertension, fibromyalgia, gestational diabetes.
